text:
League &
Bordeaux: Ui-Jo Hwang sniper
Scorer against Nantes this afternoon, the Korean Hwang Ui-Jo has once again proved his full skill in deceiving the goalkeeper from outside the area for the third time this season. A unique performance in Europe.
03 Nov 2019, 21:20 by Antoine Chirat



Eduardo Macia and Laurent KoscielnyThe Girondins de Bordeaux have managed a few hits on the transfer market this summer.Icon Sport



Laurent Koscielny- Previous club: Arsenal (England) - Transfer fees: 5 million eurosIcon Sport



Enock Kwateng- FC Nantes- Free transferIcon Sport



Loris Benito - Young Boys Bern (Switzerland) - Free transferIcon Sport



Youssef Ait Bennasser- AS Monaco- Pr√™tIcon Sport



Mexer- Stade Rennais- Free transferIcon Sport



Ui-jo Hwang - Gamba Osaka (Japan) - ‚Ç¨ 2 million Icon Sport

Bordeaux: all recruits of the transfer window 2019




Arrived in July in Bordeaux from Gamba Osaka, Hwang Ui-Jo was an enigma for French football. An enigma that gradually turns into success. Indeed, the Korean has already hit home three times this season, including one this afternoon against Nantes, and issued a decisive pass. In addition, all of his goals have been scored from outside the box. No player can say the same in the five major European leagues. An artilleryman is making his mark in Aquitaine, to the delight of the Girondins fans.
